s: ^My friend Elisa is really stressed out and I'm trying to get her some help. Do you know any former first-gen students she could talk to?

Lilamentor: ^Lila?Neutral "Hmm, I don't know anyone off the top of my head, but I can keep an eye out for you. Elisa could reach out to any first-gen upperclassmen or former students that she knows."
^Lila?Neutral "It'll also probably be more comfortable for Elisa to connect with them than it would be to meet someone brand new."
^Lila_Day 3_Someone brand new might not be the best mentor
^Lila_Day 3_Reach out to upperclassmen and former students for help_Elisa3
institutionalConnections: ^Lila?Smiling "You can also tell her that she could reach out to any first-gen teachers she knows at her school for advice. I'm sure they'd love to help her."
^Lila?Smiling "Or, if nothing else, sometimes colleges actually have specific programs to help first-gen students form a community- do you know if they have that?"
^Lila_Day 3_Reach out to teachers and make use of school programs_Elisa3
^Lila_Day 3_Colleges don't always have programs to help first-gen students

s: ^I'm not sure, but I can ask Elisa.

segueOut: ^Lila?Smiling "Awesome! Yeah, the big thing is just for Elisa to get some more support in whatever way she can."
^Lila?Smiling "Whether it's a mentor or using school resources,"
^Lila?Smiling "having a place where she can feel connected to the community and like she's not the only one going through this kind of stress will go a long way to improve her mental health."
^Lila_Day 3_Getting connected with your community can help reduce stress_Elisa3
^Lila_Day 3_Try to get support in whatever way you can
bye: ^Lila?Smiling "No problem! Good luck with the mentor-finding!"
